articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Top cryptocurrency bitcoin hit a fresh two-month low on Friday, breaking out of its recent tight range, as a wave of risk off sentiment grips world markets.
articles.title: Bitcoin drops to new two-month low as world markets sell off

articles.author: Tim Hepher, Lisa Baertlein, Allison Lampert, Valerie Insinna
articles.description: Air cargo enjoyed record demand when COVID-19 closed borders and snarled supply chains. Now, it is reeling from overcapacity and tumbling freight rates as the freight boom makes a hard landing.
articles.title: Air travel boom creates crosswinds for air cargo

articles.author: Gwladys Fouche
articles.description: Norway's $1.4 trillion wealth fund, the world's single largest stock market investor, is to step up pressure on the companies it invests in to have more women board members and to also reduce excessive executive pay, a top fund official said.
articles.title: Norway fund wants more women on boards, concerned about excessive CEO pay

articles.author: Ben Klayman
articles.description: Vietnamese electric-vehicle maker VinFast, which made a splash this week when its shares debuted on the Nasdaq, has stirred a mix of caution and interest among dealers with a recent change in how it will distribute its cars in the U.S. market.
articles.title: Focus: VinFast's new sales approach has US car dealers cautious but interested

articles.author: Richa Naidu, Martin Coulter
articles.description: Some of the world's biggest advertisers, from food giant Nestle (NESN.S) to consumer goods multinational Unilever (ULVR.L), are experimenting with using generative AI software like ChatGPT and DALL-E to cut costs and increase productivity, executives say.
articles.title: From Mad Men to machines? Big advertisers shift to AI
Ex-Trump administration officials target corporate diversity efforts

articles.author: Maytaal Angel, Jessica DiNapoli, Richa Naidu
articles.description: Chocolate makers like Hershey (HSY.N) and Mondelez (MDLZ.O) face tougher trading conditions over the next year as they attempt to pass on soaring cocoa costs to cash-strapped consumers who are cutting back.
articles.title: Chocolate makers' prospects sour as cocoa prices spike

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: How drug cartels evade authorities by using money transfers popular with migrant workers to send their earnings back to Mexico.
articles.title: How Mexican narcos use remittances to wire U.S. drug profits home

articles.author: Clare Jim, Jonathan Stempel, Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: Embattled developer China Evergrande Group (3333.HK) has filed for bankruptcy protection in a U.S. court as part of one of the world's biggest debt restructuring exercises, as anxiety grows over China's worsening property crisis and a weakening economy.
articles.title: Evergrande seeks US court nod for $32 bln debt overhaul as China economic fears mount

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A British nurse, who penned a note stating "I am evil", was found guilty on Friday of murdering seven newborn babies and trying to kill another six in the neonatal unit of a hospital in northwest England where she worked.
articles.title: 'I am evil': British nurse guilty of murdering seven newborn babies
